item.title: Unregister object help
item.dc:creator: @meatstick meatstick
item.description:
@meatstick wrote:

GameObject object = new GameObject(Point.location(x, y), id, 0, 0);
world.registerGameObject(object);
world.delayedRemoveObject(object, 2000);

item.title: Unregister object help

item.description:
@Motaro wrote:

You guys don’t understand

It can’t remove the object because (object) does not have an ID (It doesn’t know what to remove), and I need to know how to give it an ID(490).

item.title: Unregister object help
item.dc:creator: @Motaro Motaro
item.description:
@Motaro wrote:

A mithril seed is an item.

They plant trees that appear for a little while, then disappear.

My code can plant the tree, but I can’t figure out how to get it to remove it.

Read full topic

item.title: Unregister object help
item.dc:creator: @adu adu
item.description:
@adu wrote:

If mithril seed is an object, the why are you in “InvActionHandler”?

Try “InvUseOnObject” or “ObjectAction”

and import org.rscdaemon.server.packethandler.client.ObjectRemover

Read full topic

item.title: Unregister object help
item.dc:creator: @Motaro Motaro
item.description:
@Motaro wrote:

In my code in InvActionHandler.java:

[code=code] case 867: //Open a mithril seed

			GameObject object = world.getTile(player.getLocation()).getGameObject();
			world.registerGameObject(new GameObject(player.getLocation(), 490, 0, 0));
			
			if(System.currentTimeMillis()  >  System.currentTimeMillis() + 10000)
			{
		       >>>>world.unregisterGameObject(object);<<<<
			}
			break;[/code]

How can I assign (object) and ID?

It’s telling it to remove (object) from game, but since it doesn’t know what (object) is, it logs me out.

Help please!

Read full topic
